    • Maintaining, troubleshooting and repairing computer systems, hardware and computer peripherals as needed.

#WhyWorkAnywhereElse?

We work hard to develop and challenge our employees' skillsets, recognize their contributions, encourage professional development, and offer a one-of-a-kind culture. This is why we say #WhyWorkAnywhereElse?

The Data Science and Analytics team at Acuity Brands, Inc. is engaged in exploiting the power of data and analytics in optimizing Acuity’s business operations spanning pricing to supply chain. Apprenticeship programs keep pace with advancing technologies and innovations in training and human resource development through the complete involvement of employer in the educational process. Apprenticeship length is 1-year with the opportunity for a permanent role.

Position Overview

As a Java Full Stack Jr. Engineer Apprentice, you will have the opportunity to work on complex emerging technologies for some of the world’s leading companies. You will build technical and professional skills through robust training sessions with technology professionals across North America. Throughout your first two years at Cognizant, we will closely monitor your progress and offer coaching, training and support to help you achieve your long-term career goals at Cognizant.

Element Biosciences is a multi-disciplinary startup focused on innovating genetic analysis tools for the research and clinical markets. The Company's technology will broaden the end user experience through improved data quality and simplified workflows to benefit discoveries and diagnosis in healthcare.

As a Software Test Engineer Intern on the Software Product Design team, you will gain valuable hands-on experience working with cloud and device software, hardware, and embedded systems, and will also have the opportunity to collaborate and work with various stakeholders and engineers. The goal of the Software Product Design team is to define and guide seamless end-user experiences. You will help test (and help iterate the design of) a complete sequencing solution with the necessary software interfaces to the chemistry, hardware, manufacturing, and downstream analysis systems.

Responsibilities
  • Work as part of a team to design, implement, integrate, and test the software that enables the development and use of Element’s sequencing instrumentation
  • Work with software systems engineers and stakeholders to test hardware, biochemistry, instrument, cloud, and analysis interfaces and specifications
  • Take ownership of learning and advocating for the end-user experience, working to identify pain points and influencing product design to address them
  • Automate test cases as software and interfaces mature
  • Perform manual test cases, serving to test and confirm software and systems integration, as well as validating user needs and touch points
  • Assist in troubleshooting problems during development

Requirements
  • Rising senior or new grad with a degree in Bioengineering (Device), Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or similar
  • Experience working on/with integrated software and hardware devices
  • Experience writing and/or testing to software specifications
  • Knowledge of genomics and next generation sequencing
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
We are passionate about our mission to develop high performing products to study genomics in an unprecedented flexibility and to understand biology for the improvement of healthcare. We have built a highly efficient product-driven organization where employees can learn, grow and thrive in a challenging but encouraging environment. We are committed to scientific integrity, collegiality, honesty, objectivity, and openness.

We foster an environment such that all people are afforded the freedom to pursue their passions without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we’re looking for a Data Engineering Intern to join our Data Engineering team. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second; collect tens of billions of events each day; and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

Our data pipelines process between 2B to 5B events per hour. Experience gained on such data pipelines are in high demand. As a Data Engineering Intern you will work with more senior engineers in building new data pipelines on AWS, migrate pipelines to AWS or extend features and optimize performance of existing data pipelines.

What You’ll Get To Do
  • Implement data processing solutions using Big Data stack including but not limited to Hadoop, Spark, EMR and Snowflake
  • Work with data engineers and data scientists to analyze, design, code, debug, test, document, and deploy changes to the system
  • Participate in sprint meetings and daily stand-ups
  • Attend intern activities designed to allow you to develop your skills, better understand your career interests and identify opportunities for future employment
  • Network with other interns and IAS employees


Who You Are And What You Have
  • A rising senior actively working towards obtaining a BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field looking for a full-time position upon graduation
  • Relevant coursework, and interest, in build, test, automation, and DevOps frameworks
  • Experience programming in object oriented languages such as Java, C++, Scala or Python as well as proficiency in Linux
  • Basic understanding of algorithms and data structures
  • Ability to communicate clearly, verbally and in writing
  • Effective time management skills and ability to work in a team atmosphere


What Puts You Over The Top
  • Some practical experience working on AWS or another cloud provider
  • Some practical experience developing with Apache Spark and/or Hive
  • Good knowledge of SQL and experience with columnar datastores

At Giant.AI, we are focused on finding solutions to one of the greatest global challenges to the next few generations. We are a growing team, led by some of the industries’ best scientists and engineers who share a deep passion and expertise in Robotics, Deep Learning and Computer Vision. We are backed by some of the top VC’s, including Gates Frontier (Bill Gates' investment fund) and Khosla Ventures with real world customers who are excited about our technologies.

Why We Are Looking For Someone Like You

Robotics on a planetary scale is not just our tagline but our north star to why we do what we do.

A little bit about our Co-Founders:

Founder & CEO, Dr. Adrian Kaehler has a long history of innovation: he has been an inventor on many patents, as well as the author of numerous technical papers and articles in a variety of subjects ranging from particle physics to biometrics to architecture to robotics. He has led projects in a wide variety of technical domains including commercial, industrial, and military and ranging in scope from boutique to global scale mass production, on land, in the air, in space, and under the oceans.

Co-Founder, Dr. Chris Cianci holds undergraduate degrees in Physics (Occidental College, 2001) and Electrical Engineering (Caltech, 2003), and completed his doctorate on Distributed Robotics at L'Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne in Switzerland (2009). He has done extensive work in robotic autonomy, ranging from autonomous vehicles to one of the first consumer autonomous home vacuum cleaners, shipping millions of units worldwide. When forced to drive himself (because the self-driving cars aren't quite ready yet), he can often be found traveling in a 1974 MGB that he is in the process of restoring himself.

We are a global company. Our corporate headquarters is in Campbell, CA. We also have offices in Burbank, CA, and internationally.

position: 2021 Summer Intern, Data Science – Advanced Analytics
description:
At CGI you’re going to learn fast. You’re going to be challenged and you’re going to get the hands-on experience you need for a long, successful career.

Culture

At CGI, our people make our organization. We value the skills, strengths and perspectives of our diverse team. We strive to create an environment where employees can flourish and succeed. We stand for excellence—but also for each other. We stand strong…because we stand together. Our cultural attributes describe how we live our Values. At CGI that means being One Team, Effective, Passionate, Accountable and Creative.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The Advanced Analytics team at Chamberlain is looking for enthusiastic data science interns to lead the design, development, and deployment of advanced analytics solutions supporting CGI’s strategic business priorities.

During the internship program, you will initiate, manage, and deliver a project, including creating and training statistical models and algorithms and providing insights and user-friendly tools and capabilities to enable data-driven decisions by business stakeholders. Upon completion of the project, you will have the opportunity to present your results and findings to Chamberlain’s Executive Leadership Team.

Internships at Chamberlain are designed to give college students opportunities to complement their formal education with career-related experience. Interns will have an abundance of hands-on development opportunities and interactions in a real-world business environment. As a member of the Advanced Analytics team, you will work closely with senior data scientists, engineers, architects, and business partners.

Essential Functions
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and advanced analytics business partners to understand business needs and to identify and define advanced analytics solutions
  • Evaluate analytical and machine learning techniques to achieve business objectives
  • Execute analytic activities supporting solution development, including data gathering, cleansing, and integration, statistical transformation and modeling, and feature engineering and selection
  • Design, develop, and deploy advanced analytics solution, including predictive and prescriptive outputs, analytical tools and visualization capabilities to enable business users to make data-driven decisions
  • Create documentation and training materials for end-user understanding
  • Effectively communicate results and findings to stakeholders and Chamberlain’s Executive Leadership Team upon internship completion

Qualifications
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Information Systems, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field of study
  • Experience using Python and/or R to manipulate and draw insights from large datasets
  • Knowledge of advanced analytical techniques, including multivariate statistics, forecasting, predictive modeling, and cluster analysis
  • Experience in manipulating, analyzing, and interpreting large-scale data
  • Experience in data visualization tools, including Power BI
  • Exceptional intellectual curiosity and problem-solving skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Teamwork and collaboration
  • Strong communication skills

Additional Requirements
  • Must be enrolled in a program of study at an accredited college or university.
  • Must be committed to the duration of the internship program, generally 12 - 14 weeks.
  • Must possess an unrestricted right to work in the United States (Please note: we are unable to hire students on F1 visas at this time)
  • GPA minimum: 3.2 overall and 3.5 in major on a 4.0-point scale
Career Development Intern Opportunities

CGI’s Career Development Intern Opportunities are designed to give college students an opportunity to complement their formal education with career-related experience.

In An Effort To Accomplish This, Students Must
  • Work on applying knowledge acquired in the classroom to real-world business situations
  • Develop a self-awareness of attitudes, values, and behavior patterns that positively influence the work environment
  • Utilize learning opportunities such as training, meetings, or conferences offered by Chamberlain Group
  • Share ideas and provide new insight
  • Handle confidential information in a professional and ethical manner
  • Assume personal and professional responsibility for his/her actions and activities
  • Maintain professional relationships with Chamberlain Group’s employees, clients, and customers, both internal and external
  • Complete work assignments in a thorough, consistent, and punctual manner
  • Create and deliver an end of program presentation to Top Leaders
  • Adhere to Chamberlain Group’s policies and procedures
Oak Brook Headquarters

CGI's headquarters is a 4-story, state-of-the-art new building in Oak Brook, Illinois. Designed for natural light and surrounded by a 3/4-mile walking path, CGI HQ was designed for better health, better collaboration and better performance.

Chamberlain is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.

Company Description

DNAnexus is the leading cloud-based SaaS company serving the global life science community. DNAnexus' health informatics platform serves customers across a spectrum of industries — government, biopharmaceutical, clinical diagnostics, healthcare, and academic research in 33 countries with compliant protection of data, privacy, and intellectual property. The platform provides a secure and collaborative environment where genomics, multi-omics, and real world data can be combined with clinical data at scale, providing new insights that can lead to improved diagnostics, new targeted therapies and better patient care. For more information on DNAnexus, please visit www.dnanexus.com or follow the company @DNAnexus.

Job Description

We're looking for interns to join our technical scientific outreach team! If you are an intellectually curious and driven student in a graduate or undergraduate program looking for a rewarding internship that combines your passion for science, product development and business, we should talk.

The Science Intern will work closely with the rest of the DNAnexus Research Platform Team to build tools, example resources, training and other documentation to support research done with data provided by UK Biobank and other large datasets.

This Includes
  • Making cool projects related to machine learning, data federation, spark, image analysis and other realms of data science digestible by and presentable to data scientists
  • Understanding and then organizing optimal workflows for bioinformatics and image analysis for researchers who will use the UK Biobank dataset.
Qualified applicants will be currently enrolled college or graduate students in a bioinformatics or another genomics/computational biology-related degree program OR is in a business or software management program with a strong passion and background related to bioinformatics, genomics, or precision medicine.

Requirements
  • Experience with or exposure to software development.
  • Experience with rapid software prototyping
  • Self-starter approach to work, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed objectives
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to prioritize and execute on initiatives
  • Detail-oriented with high standards of quality work
  • Ability to interact and team with others is essential. Must be able to partner within organization to generate results
  • Demonstrated analytical capabilities including the ability to analyze and report metrics
  • Technical skills, one or more or the following: R, Python, Jupyter Notebooks, github, bioinformatics pipelines
Qualifications

Education And Certifications
  • Currently attending a graduate or undergraduate program in Bioinformatics, Genetics, Computational Biology,, Computer Science, or business (MBA or Technology Management preferred).
  • For business or computer science majors, coursework or another degree in science (biology, genetics, bioinformatics) medicine or healthcare a plus.

Additional Information

Why Our Work Is Important

Science is social. It is about discovering, sharing and building upon the findings of others. For biomedical data to realize its true value, it requires openness and collaboration, but at the same time a secure environment to handle sensitive information. DNAnexus provides a dynamic platform where data protection, analysis, and collaboration allow for open conversations, new ideas and precise outcomes. Precision medicine is the future. Join our team and be a part of this revolution, delivering on the potential to predict, prevent, and personalize treatments through precision medicine.

If you are interested in joining our team, please apply today!

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

So, if the leading edge of media technology is the place you want to be, please contact us today and let’s start the conversation!

/CADENT/ is an EOE M/F/D/V. We do not work with 3rd Party Staffing Agencies

Black Diamond Therapeutics is a precision oncology medicine company pioneering the discovery and development of small molecule, tumor-agnostic therapies. Black Diamond targets undrugged mutations in patients with genetically defined cancers for whom limited treatment options currently exist. Black Diamond is built upon a deep understanding of cancer genetics, protein structure and function, and medicinal chemistry. The Company’s proprietary technology platform, Mutation-Allostery-Pharmacology, or MAP, platform, is designed to allow Black Diamond to analyze population-level genetic sequencing data to identify oncogenic mutations that promote cancer across tumor types, group these mutations into families and develop a single small molecule therapy in a tumor-agnostic manner that targets a specific family of mutations.

We are looking for a Summer Intern to join our Computational Sciences team. This is a Full-time paid Internship for 3-4 months which can be remote.

The Computational Science Intern will join our MAP platform team to further expand our capabilibies in machine learning to delineate the relationships among protein sequences, structures, dynamics and allosteric mutations.

Key Responsibilities

Work under supervision of BDTX scientists to implement machine learning-based methods to enhance the power of our MAP oncogenic mutation prediction platform.
  • Sc./M.Sc./Ph.D. students or graduates in computer science/machine learning/bioinformatics
  • Experience in machine learning and deep learning
  • Background in biochemistry preferable
  • Fluency in Python and scripting in a Unix/Linux environment
  • Excellent communication skills and strong team player
Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to fingers, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift or move office products and supplies up to 20 lbs.

BIOMILQ is developing technology to make breastmilk outside the body, produced from mammary cells. We’re making the future of feeding fearless, and 100% human by offering families a new option for supplemental feeding — one that’s as close to breastmilk as possible and cultivated under safe conditions using our first-of-its-kind technology.

Our provisional patent-pending process leverages the unique biological properties of milk-producing mammary epithelial cells combined with bioreactor technology developed to collect secreted cellular products. The high-density, 3-dimensional system provides similar structural features as the mammary gland, creating the appropriate environment for the cells to reproduce their biological function of milk production, outside of the body. Our process enables us to produce milk that requires no downstream separation, concentration, or intensive thermal processing so we can retain all 2500+ molecules of milk in the perfect constellation for bioavailability and digestibility in infants.

Applications are due April 25, 2021

The Connected Analytics team works with public power utility clients in more effectively operating their electricity networks and engaging with customers through data-driven insights from utilities’ smart metering systems. ByteDance Networking brings together innovative ideas and technologies from network architecture, software defined networking (SDN), network virtualization, switch software and hardware co-design, and high-speed networking, to create hyperscale data-center networking solutions that power several of the most popular apps of the world such as Douyin and TikTok which serve hundreds of millions of users around the globe.


ByteDance Networking is responsible for designing, building, and operating the global, intelligent network infrastructure to meet the requirements of high availability, scalability, and high-performance. • Develop network as a large-scale system by providing network data collection, analysis and visualization, control, incident mitigation and healing

• Master networking programming and networking tools in Linux

• Master one or several mainstream programming languages C/C++, Python, Go, Java

• Familiar with mainstream network devices, and/or the state-of-the-art technologies and trends in networking and systems

• Experience in developing distributed systems is a plus

• Bachelor's or higher degree in computer science, EE, or related fields


Application deadline: April 15th 2021

* Interview starts in Dec 2020.

Summary

Waybridge is a well-funded startup using technology and data science to create efficiencies in the multi-trillion-dollar industry of trading and logistics of physical commodities. We are currently a team comprising technology experts who have revolutionized the ad-tech industry, commodity experts with years of experience in various commodities, and award-winning designers and product managers. We are based in New York, London, and remote.

This posting is for a software engineering intern to join our team in Summer 2021. You will be joined by past interns who are now full-time employees.

In this role, you will be a full-fledged engineer as part of one of our 'tech teams':
  • You will work alongside other engineers in sprints, tackling different tickets as allocated to you. You will be part of daily standups, sprint retros, and discussions with design and products.
  • You will be expected to write tech specs, and implement these in different parts of our stacks.
  • You will be involved in company-wide meetings and discussions, including Engineering Weekly, All Hands, Learn N' Teach, and more.
  • You will learn from other team members and meet with different functions within the organization.
  • You will be assigned a dedicated mentor who will help guide you through the program.

As a software engineer in a smaller company, your work will have a meaningful impact on the product. You will get to experience firsthand what it takes to make a successful startup and product.

Applicant Profile

You need to have some experience in computer programming. A computer science degree is 100% not required. However, you need to demonstrate an ability and interest in writing code and solving problems.

Our tech stack is:
  • Python and GraphQL.
  • React, Relay, and Typescript.
  • AWS, Kubernetes, Docker.
  • Automated CI/CD with dev, staging, and production environments.

Experience in any of these is useful, but do not be put off from applying if your experience does not match our stack.

Project Summary

Think about how easy it is for you to purchase something online; you can see various options, filter by different features, and then once ordered, track where your delivery is until it arrives at your doorstep.

It might surprise you that such systems do not yet exist for manufacturers or suppliers looking to buy or sell raw material, such as aluminum, copper, or cocoa. Thanks to many challenges involved, particularly due to the size of the market, such purchases are currently extremely manual, using a combination of emails, phone calls, text messages to track purchases, sales, and deliveries.

We are tackling these problems by:
  • Bringing market intelligence and pricing tools to small and big manufacturers and producers of physical commodities.
  • Providing financing, price discovery and other facilities we are creating a more transparent marketplace and enabling companies to trade with new counterparties.
  • Improving logistic and tracking of commodities around the world. This means optimized delivery routes, with benefits such as a reduction in carbon footprint.

More specifically, as an engineer, here are some of the problems you might tackle:
  • Design and develop new features Trade Management Platform and see them come to life in our customers' hands.
  • Implement new pricing algorithms and models to predict the underlying asset's value
  • Implement new application visibility and insights for internal stakeholders and customers
  • Redesign subsystems of the platform to improve performance, correctness, and modularity
  • interacting with client/data provider APIs to enhance the visibility of our platform's commodity trades.

Diversity

We are proud to have a diverse team, with many of our current teams comprising individuals from underrepresented groups in the technology industry. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we value and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our employees. However, we know we can always do better and always happy to hear thoughts and recommendations.

Disability

We are happy to try and accommodate individuals who may need additional provisions to be able to work comfortably. Please do ask any questions you have with this regard by reaching out to us directly at any time before or after applying.

position: Business Intelligence Analyst Intern (Systems Analyst / Business Analyst Internship)
description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Intern

(Systems Analyst / Business Analyst / Data Analyst / Data Architect / Information Technology Analyst / Database Administrator Internship)


Firm Overview and Position Summary:

Duart Mull is an Atlanta-based investor that takes an active role in assisting its portfolio companies in their strategic growth plans. The primary focus of the Duart Mull team is working as a consultant partner to its portfolio companies in order to identify opportunities to connect management to the information that helps them make better decisions. In order to support the growth of its portfolio companies, Duart Mull is seeking to add a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Intern to the team to design and implement systems and processes to (1) support dashboarding, operating analytics, and ad hoc analysis projects to aid strategic decisions and (2) streamline automation and back-office processes. This position is a unique opportunity to work with the private equity capital partner of an exciting variety of growth-stage companies. If you are seeking a very challenging and rewarding environment in which to grow your skills and experience in a broad range of high-growth companies, this may be a fit for you.


The skillset required for this role is heavily concentrated in relational databases, third-party RESTful APIs, and the various tools that connect to data sources in order to analyze operations/transaction data and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations for management oversight and business process optimization. The successful candidate must have a solid understanding of relational databases, proficiency in SQL, experience in the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of various data sources, familiarity in REST or SOAP APIs/ web services, and strong analytic skills. In addition to the required technical skillset, extraordinary verbal and written communication abilities are also required.


As a Business Intelligence Analyst Intern, the average breakdown of time is about 60% developing methods to optimize and report on portfolio company operations, 10% researching various aspects of prospective investment targets’ operations and systems, 15% executing weekly and monthly ETL tasks required for financial reporting/operational accounting functions, and 15% working in Duart Mull’s internal operations. Most activities involve connecting to each companies’ ERP/CRM systems and to third party APIs as data sources and normalizing data in order to create data models, reports, visualizations, real-time dashboards, and to facilitate data import and transfer functions between systems. The typical areas of focus include defining and optimizing customer acquisition processes, analyzing and presenting operations data, making marketing analytics actionable, development and execution of data flows between financial reporting & accounting systems, systems development, and technology selection.


The technologies/tools typically employed are SQL, Microsoft Excel, Power Query, Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Salesforce, and Microsoft SharePoint. Prior experience in software development/ coding and database design is considered favorably in evaluation of skills. An existing expert-level knowledge of Excel is required and a willingness to learn the tactical administrative functions of SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, prevalent general ledger systems like Quickbooks and Microsoft Dynamics GP is a requirement if those skills are not already in place.


Required Education and Experience:

  • Enrolled in or recently completed a 4 Year Degree program from a top-tier campus-based university.

Preferred Undergraduate Major in management information systems, computer science, engineering, business administration, accounting, finance, mathematics, or relevant analytical discipline

  • 2+ years of analysis or information technology experience in an academic and/or business environment.


Required Skills:

  • Strong Quantitative Analysis and Numeric Reasoning.
  • Proficiency in relational database design and Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD).
  • Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
  • Prior experience/Familiarity with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau.
  • Advanced/Expert level in Microsoft Excel.
  • Intermediate level in JSON or XML.
  • Intermediate level in RESTful or SOAP APIs/ web services.
  • Intermediate level in HTML.
  • Prior experience/Familiarity in software development/coding using one of the following languages: JavaScript/ Java, PHP, Python, Visual Basic, C/C++, PEARL, or ASP.net.
  • Natural English ability to expertly communicate verbally and in written form to a diverse and non-technical audience.
  • Ability to learn and apply complex technical information quickly.
  • Ability to work and excel on multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
  • High level of independence, assertiveness, and decisiveness.


Desired Experience: (Not necessarily required.)

  • Microsoft Azure, MS SQL Server, and Cloud-based Data Warehousing.
  • Microsoft CRM and/or Salesforce.
  • Microsoft Power Query (M) and Microsoft Data Analysis Expressions (DAX).
  • Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).
  • Knowledge of accounting and finance.


Beyond just education, skills, & experience:

  • You are honest and trustworthy.
  • Your work is accurate and you take accountability for your results because you know others have to trust and depend on you.
  • Although early in your career, you are mature, confident, and professional.
  • You have an authentic passion for making businesses better and providing value to your teammates.
  • You are obsessed with numbers, a logical thinker, but also enjoy the opportunity to be creative.
  • You are a process person who plans obsessively and has the skills and background to prove it.
  • You are flexible and work hard and expect the same of your teammates.
  • You are curious, open-minded, and love the challenge of learning something new every day.


Compensation:

  • Paid Internship commensurate with prior experience and credentials.
  • Desire for interns to join the firm as a Full-time employee after completing academic program.
  • Hours are flexible based upon academic requirements.

Job Type: Internship Full-time / Part-time

TikTok

About Verkada

At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we’re transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades—and we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.

Verkada is the leader in cloud managed video surveillance and physical security. Our mission is to be the essential physical security software layer for every building, and the foundation of a larger enterprise IoT infrastructure. As a Technical Support Intern, you will work on leading-edge cloud managed IoT technology while providing troubleshooting, design, and integration assistance to our growing base of enterprise customers. Interns work on the same issues and projects as full-time Technical Support Engineers, so if you are interested in making an impact and learning valuable career skills in a highly technical real-world environment, come join us.

Responsibilities
    • Troubleshoot network, hardware and software issues related to the Verkada platform.
    • Provide best practice design and integration expertise to enterprise customers.
    • Communicate technical matters to customers both orally and in writing.
    • Own customer issues from creation to resolution.
    • Collaborate with Engineering and Product teams to test new products and identify bugs.
    • Contribute content to our Knowledge Base.
    • Lab testing and team projects.

Requirements
    • Third or Fourth year college student working towards a Bachelor’s or Master's degree in a related technical discipline: Networking, Telecommunications, Systems Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Cybersecurity from an accredited college.
    • Coursework with a focus on computer networking, Linux, computer systems, Python or other coding language.
    • Ability to communicate complex matters to customers both orally and in writing.
    • Demonstrated problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
    • Ability to work within a team environment.
    • Industry certifications are a plus: CCNP, CCNA, CCENT, CCDA, CWNP, CWNA, MCSE, CEH, Network+, Security+, A+.

About Our Team

Behind the scenes, we’re a team of computer scientists, hardware engineers and experienced founders who saw a chance to make a real impact. We’re united by the challenge of building beautiful products, designed for real people—and by our commitment to using technology responsibly. We believe keeping data private and secure is core to our safety as individuals, businesses and communities and we put great care into building systems that embody our values as people. Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

Overview

ERP International is currently seeking an Information Technology (IT ) Intern to participate in our 2021 Summer Internship Program. ERP's Internship Program is focused on identifying high potential and capable students and providing them with exposure and on the job experiences that help strengthen their skills and prepare them for their future careers. The ideal candidate for this internship is a rising Junior or Senior pursuing a degree at an accredited college or university and has a desire to pursue a career in Information Technology or a related field. This individual will work with a talented team of IT professionals and will gain hands on experience by being involved in key tasks in support of the department's goals. As part of the internship Program all interns will have the opportunity to collaborate with their peer group, participate in executive sessions and learn about company and industry.

Hiring During the COVID-19 Pandemic: Due to the current COVID restrictions, this role is 100% remote. ERP provides all the tools and resources for employees to be successful in a remote work environment.

Culture of ERP: Fast paced, fun, collaborative, energetic, and positive.

ERP International ( www.erpinternational.com ) ERP International, LLC is a trusted health, science and technology solutions provider proven to create transformational results – driving our government and commercial sector customers to be their best. We are a recognized leader in leveraging our mature capabilities to build scalable, resilient, high performance business solutions and empowering organizations to deliver on the promises of excellence. We bring together brainpower, insightful research, qua ntitative benchmarking, innovation, maturely structured problem-solving methodologies, and hands-on experience to improve our clients’ business environments. ERP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Disability and Veteran.

Be the Best! ERP International is honored to have been named one of The Washington Post’s 2020 Top Workplaces!

Working in a team environment, the intern will be an energetic self-starter and entrepreneurs at heart. The intern will provide support to the Information Technology Department and also provide support for various ERP departments and projects.

  • Support the Information Technology Department with all aspects of IT and development
  • Support tasks related to SharePoint and website management
  • Support deployment and management of IT assets
  • Other duties as assigned

Other Areas Of Responsibility
  • Support other Corporate Departments as required
  • Provide general administrative support to additional departments and assist with special projects, as needed

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements

  • Rising junior or senior pursuing a Bachelor's Degree studying Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
  • Detail-oriented, able to multi-task, able to work independently while meeting specific deadlines
  • Experience with computer programs (MS Office, etc.)

    • Desired Requirements

  • 3.0 or higher GPA

This is an exciting opportunity for a Customer Application Engineer. This is an Internship position in the RUN Team at Ivalua. You will be first point of contact for Clients who have implemented Ivalua Solution and are engaged with us in the Maintenance / Support (post go live) workstream.

About Ivalua

Ivalua is developing a new generation of Procurement technology products. A “Magic Quadrant” leader, Ivalua’s solutions work in a complex global economy. Our innovative Procure-to-Pay solutions include automating configured workflows to request, procure, receive, and pay for goods and services across the enterprise, refining the procurement lifecycle while reducing cost and risk of spending on indirect goods, direct goods and services, and improving supplier collaboration.

About The Team

You will be part of the Support Team whose mission is to maintain customer applications, successfully deliver enhancements, updates and upgrades to customers, proactively monitor production environments and take actions to improve the overall user experience and the business value provided to our Customers. The Support Team operates with high quality standards and strong commitment to excellence and efficiency. Our team is very hands-on with a strong mindset of problem solving while also having the ability to think of the implementation holistically and provide solutions that solve the customer’s long-term challenges.

Our team works hard, plays hard and enjoys all indoor and outdoor activities that the company organizes from time to time, so that you can focus, work collaboratively, and be at your creative best.

Key Responsibilities
  • Manage the customer relationship. Gather business requirements and analyze the impact on the implemented solution. Advise Customers on procurement leading practices and configuration management.
  • Use Ivalua Buyer technical framework (C# .NET & SQL) to configure and customize Ivalua Buyer solution to meet specific business requirements
  • Reverse engineering and debugging to solve project issues throughout all phases of the implementation cycle
  • Develop advanced configuration knowledge and show strong technical creativity skills to leverage configuration features in order to limit custom code
  • Interact with R&D team for product features
  • Manage deliveries and solve technical operational issues
  • Contribute to peer code review
Skills

You Need To Succeed
  • 0-6 months of experience in software development, primarily in C#, .NET and SQL Server
  • Ability to understand complex functional and technical environments and communicate technical concepts to non-technical people
  • Serve as mentor to colleagues and project teams
  • Comfortable looking for configuration solutions versus new coding and development
  • Functional knowledge of SRM, Supply Chain, and/or Procurement is a plus
  • Manage client relationships, self-driven, results oriented, strong leadership and exceptional communication skills
  • Occasional travel and on call requirements
  • You will go through Ivalua’s certification process to learn the Product.
Preferred Education
  • Bachelor (BS) degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a closely related field or foreign equivalent

Join Ivalua today and procure a great future for your career!

Description


AI4Finance is a FinTech firm to advance AI in Finance, currently focusing on deep reinforcement learning.


FinRL is the open source library for beginners and practitioners. To efficiently automate trading, AI4Finance provides this educational library and makes it easier to learn about deep reinforcement learning (DRL) in quantitative finance.


FinRL Github:

https://github.com/AI4Finance-LLC/FinRL-Library

﻿

FinRL YouTube:

﻿https://youtu.be/ZSGJjtM-5jA


As a summer intern on our team, your role is to leverage your strong background in Computer Science, Statistics, Financial Engineering and Machine Learning to help maintain our FinRL library, perform data engineering and feature extraction, design new functionalities, implement DRL algorithms, and apply FinRL to common financial tasks, including stock trading, portfolio allocation, cryptocurrency trading, high-frequency trading, etc.


Your Responsibilities Include

  • Manage the full ML project lifecycle, including data mining, analysis and engineering, model prototyping, training & evaluation, containerization, unit testing, performance optimization, and deployment.
  • Deliver custom, highly scalable machine learning and deep reinforcement learning solutions through prototyping, POC, and quantitative metrics.
  • Publish research findings in leading academic venues and represent AI4Finance at industry conferences targeting at ACM International Conference on AI in Finance (ICAIF), AAAI, and NeurIPS Deep RL Workshop.


Basic Qualifications

  • Ph.D. or MS in CS, Machine Learning or in a highly quantitative field.
  • 2+ years of hands-on experience (academic or industrial) in predictive modeling and large data analysis.
  • Strong coding and problem-solving skills in at least one programming language such as Python, R, Scala, etc.


Preferred Qualifications

  • Background with Markov Decision Process and/or Reinforcement Learning
  • Publication record in top venues in the candidate’s field (ICAIF, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, IEEE, etc.).
  • Experience using an object-oriented language to write production-ready code.
  • Experience using open-source libraries such as OpenAI, TensorFlow, PyTorch.


Additional Information

Work Authorization/Sponsorship

  • U.S. work authorization is required throughout the internship, but F1 (OPT) is acceptable for this position.
  • We are not accepting resumes for people on H1-B or requiring H1-B transfers or sponsorship.

Description

Position

at BFA

About The Role

We are looking for a highly-motivated and beauty enthusiasts student to join our Machine Learning Engineering team. We have a range of exciting projects to meet your technical interests including large-scale classification of short text, deep learning problems for recommender systems, causal inference and heterogeneous treatment effects, as well as unsupervised user segmentation.

This will be a 3-month long internship and will start in the Summer of 2021. Each intern will be assigned a mentor and have the opportunity to lead their projects and present their results to the wider organization.

What You’ll Be Doing;
  • Work with a dedicated mentor to scope a project that fits our business needs and your technical interests
  • Develop exploratory data analysis to make the case for your project
  • Develop ML models to solve business objectives. Projects include: NLP, recommender systems, data augmentation, causal inference, and unsupervised user segmentation
  • Document your work via internal wikis, design documents, recorded demos, and slide presentations
What We’re Looking For
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors, Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or related field
  • Solid programming skills in Python
  • Practical experience in one or more of the following areas: natural language processing, causal inference, recommender systems, or deep learning
  • Practical experience with cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively as a member of a team
Time Commitment: 40 hours per week

Over half a billion videos are watched across millions of websites on a JW Player video player every day. Our product teams leverage data coming from our player to measure success, prioritize our next steps, and envision new possibilities for the thousands of video publishers we serve daily across the web. We iterate quickly, conduct frequent experiments as part of product development, and seek to be data driven in everything we do.

We are seeking talented candidates for a 12-24 week internship with the Data Science and Product Analytics team. In this role you will work closely with product managers, data scientists, and other key stakeholders to develop insights that inform data driven decision making. Your findings will impact not only business strategy but also the next generation of JW Player products, from our flagship video player and video platform to our video recommendations service and advertising products. You'll play a critical role in improving these products and guiding our future development efforts.

As an Intern, Product Analytics & Data Science
  • Work closely everyday with members of the Product Analytics and Data Science team (see a recent blog post from our team here)
  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Business Managers, and other key stakeholders
  • Create dashboards to visualize data and track product features
  • Conduct deep dive analysis to inform product and business strategy

Who You Are:
  • A Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in statistics, computer science, mathematics, operations research, economics or related fields
  • 1+ years experience writing SQL - proficient level
  • Experience with data visualization tools
  • Strong knowledge of statistics and probability
  • Good organization skills, ability to work with multiple teams
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex information to non-technical audiences
  • Curiosity and creativity
  • A self-starting, data-driven mindset

Bonus points:
  • Experience with Python or R for data analysis and/or modeling
  • Tech and/or media industry experience
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively on a multi-disciplinary team
  • Experience with Looker
  • Advanced degree
  • Familiarity with statistical modeling and/or machine learning
  • Experience engineering analytics pipelines


About JW Player

JW Player pioneered video on the web over a decade ago and continues to innovate as the world's largest network-independent platform for video delivery and intelligence. Media companies including Fox, VICE, Business Insider, and Univision, in addition to hundreds of thousands of creators of all types and sizes, rely on JW Player to deliver and monetize their content across all devices. JW Player's massive global footprint of over 2 billion unique devices creates a powerful data graph of unique consumer insights and generates billions of incremental video views. The company is headquartered in New York, with offices in London and Eindhoven, and was named to Deloitte's Technology Fast 500™ in 2018. For more information, visit http://www.jwplayer.com.

Our Perks

When you join JW Player, you are not just joining a company or a team but a family. Our goal is to take care of you and ensure you will be successful in your new role. Your success is our success.
  • An opportunity to make an impact in a fast paced environment
  • Bi - Annual Hack Weeks
  • AMA (Ask Me Anything) and Fireside chats with Executives & JW Player family

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Brain is an early-stage startup with an ambitious vision: reinvent human-computer interaction, connecting people more naturally with services and products. We have an incredible team, with investments led by Laurene Powell Jobs and Goodwater Capital.

As an NLP intern at Brain, you'll be working with the NLP team to apply state-of-the-art NLP techniques to our iOS application. Ideally, this would involve not only developing and/or training algorithms for NLP using our knowledge and/or application data, but also putting these algorithms into our production Python web services.

How you'll contribute to the vision:

  • Develop and/or train NLP algorithms for Brain's deployed application
  • Analyze field data from deployed application and fix errors by updating algorithms, testing, moving to production, and assessing field performance.
  • Build and maintain Python web services for NLP that support thousands of users of our live iOS application.
  • Improve and optimize the real-time performance of Python NLP web services, making sure users get a timely great experience.
  • Create corpora of training and evaluation data for state-of-the-art NLP models.
  • Design and build data pipelines and ETL pipelines for creating relevant data sets and for monitoring performance and status.
  • Design and build pipelines for automatic training and evaluation of state-of-the-art NLP models.
  • Extend and maintain critical dashboards used to monitor application performance.
  • Interface with both NLP and back-end engineering teams.

We're excited about you because you:

  • Are currently pursuing or recently completed a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D in computer science, mathematics, or related field
  • Have a strong interest and potentially coursework/background in AI, Machine Learning, and/or Natural Language Processing
  • 2+ years experience programming, preferably including Python.
  • Empathy - you can clearly communicate your thoughts and opinions to others.
  • You are fearlessly self-driven, yet enjoy helping others meet our goals.
  • You enjoy solving problems and helping others meet our goals.

We know you work hard! Below are some benefits with working at Brain:

  • We are a small team. You get to see many aspects of building a great product!
  • We are also a growing team. We have plans to offer a lot more.
  • Be a part of something massive and influence outcomes for our business.
  • The ability to make, own and carry out decisions.

About Brain:

Brain Technologies is based in San Mateo, California and was founded by serial entrepreneur Jerry Yue in December 2015 after founding multiple successful tech companies in Beijing including billion dollar company Benlai. Brain currently hosts its growing team in San Mateo, Silicon Valley and Beijing, China. If you are an iOS Developer that aligns with the above vision & qualification, please apply to join us today!

Job Description: 2021 AI Research Intern (NLP/ML)

Job Location: Mountain View, CA

Job Type: Spring/Summer Internship

Department: AI Research

NLP Research Intern

JD.com AI Research is looking for student interns to work on research areas in natural language processing, including natural language understanding, natural language generation, spoken dialog systems, question answering, machine reading comprehension, and knowledge graph learning.

Qualifications:
  • Ph.D. or masters degree in computer science or NLP related field.
  • Ability to communicate/collaborate with other researchers/engineers including our team members in China (ability to speak Chinese is NOT required).
  • Ability to implement experiments using scripting languages (Python, Perl, bash) and tools written in C/C++.
  • Experience working with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, Pytorch, Torch, Mxnet, CNTK, etc.) and related tools in each special field.
  • Publication record in top NLP conferences (ACL, NAACL, EMNLP, NIPS, SIGIR, WWW etc) is a plus.


Machine Learning Research Intern

JD AI Research is looking for student interns to work on a wide variety of research areas in machine learning, including knowledge graph, deep learning, reinforcement learning, representation learning, etc.

Qualifications:
  • Ph.D. or master's degree in computer science, machine learning related field.

Build the analytics to help Flexport grow


The opportunity:


As a Data Analytics Intern, you will work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You’ll have the opportunity to improve an industry by analyzing the new operating system for global trade. You will own and work through an entire data analytics project end-to-end over 12 weeks. 


It will ultimately culminate in delivering a production ready feature and presenting it and your process to our team. The Data Analytics team at Flexport has an enormous variety in the types of projects they work on and covers all Flexport departments, including Growth Marketing, Operations Excellence, Ocean Procurement, and everything in between.


You will:

  • Lead and complete at least one data analytics project that will be used in production.
  • Work with a supportive mentor who has a stake in your success and will help you grow.
  • Work cross-functionally with the entirety of Flexport - analytics, engineering, product, and business teams.
  • Apply analytical and statistical concepts from your education and work experience to real world challenges.
  • Learn and use our modern analytics tech stack, including dbt, Airflow, Snowflake, and Looker.


You should have:

  • Rising senior actively pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field, or have previous internship experience in an analyst role.
  • Completed coursework in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related fields.
  • SQL fluency, with experience using a scripting language like Python or R. Strong Excel fundamentals a plus.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Looker preferred).


You will get:

  • An assigned manager and mentor who will be dedicated to your success at Flexport. 
  • Projects and assignments which will help build your knowledge and skills while making a direct impact on the business.
  • Visibility to leaders within the organization and opportunities to present your work/projects.
  • Opportunity to join team building activities to get you familiarized with both your immediate team and other Flexport employees.


Bonus:

  • Bring experience and/or knowledge of something we can learn from you! Internships are at their best when they’re bi-directional.
  • We value culture adds, not culture fits, so bring your full, authentic self!


About Flexport:

We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That’s why it’s our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator. We’re excited about the three big ways we’re moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.


﻿Worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?

  • Don’t be! We’re building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That’s why it’s incredibly important for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
  • What’s freight forwarding and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another and it’s what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
  • We know this industry is complex. That’s why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.
  • At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

This is a paid internship starting in June 2021 and ending in September 2021 with potential extension based on business needs. We are looking for candidates who are available to work minimum 30 hours, max 40 hours - flexible with schedule between Monday - Friday 9am-5pm PST.

About The Role

The role provides a hands-on opportunity to learn and experience data engineering from a full life-cycle of design, development, testing, and production deployment. The data and tools utilized will not be sandbox curated but real-life production. The areas of focus will include developing etl processes, data/table design, and data virtualization to purpose build deliverables to support business stakeholder needs.

Your usual day of awesomeness includes:
  • Data virtualization
  • Data Quality Monitoring
  • API Sourcing and Pushing
  • Extract, Transform, and Load data

  • Keen eye for detail and a commitment to excellence.

About Opensesame

OpenSesame helps develop the world's most productive and admired workforces. With the most comprehensive catalog of elearning courses from the world's top publishers, we are here to help our customers every step of the way, from finding courses, mapping them to core competencies, syncing with the LMS to increasing utilization and improving L&D programs.

Position Overview

The OpenSesame Data Science team is offering a paid internship position for a qualified student for the summer of 2021. If you are a self-starter with an inquisitive mind and enjoy working on fun, useful projects, then check out this internship opportunity!

Our interns work side by side members of our team to develop models and improve our ML infrastructure. You will be an apprentice on an experienced agile team and learn first hand how machine learning systems are created here at OpenSesame. As you become part of our team, you'll work with us to:
  • Develop and execute individual & team goals (both personal and professional).
  • Work on individual & team software engineering projects.
  • Learn how each department interacts in our company.
  • Join in each team meeting & event.
  • Network with other interns and our software engineers for the best experience possible.
  • As a summer intern at OpenSesame, you will be expected to take training courses, participate in scheduled intern program events such as learning opportunities, networking events, community service, and book club, as well as participate in an intern led group project.

As an intern on the Data Science team, you will have the opportunity to take ownership of prototyping a new model or improvement to our existing models and be involved in designing and improving our machine learning infrastructure.

About The Team

Our Data Science team has a strong culture of working in an agile, continuously improving, and automation-oriented environment. We recognize the need to always be evolving, to look objectively at where things are getting better or worse, and take action.

We design and implement new machine learning algorithms and approaches to curate, personalize, and recommend content to OpenSesame customers. We currently own recommendation, similar content, search, and course enrichment models and are always prototyping new models to add to our offering. All our models are built on a strong foundation of NLP for making sense of the courses we offer.

Our team is responsible for end-to-end machine learning systems; everything from experimentation, data exploration, and new proof of concepts to data pipelines, CI/CD, and API development. We write in Python, SQL, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, and Transformers. The main tools we use are Jupyter Notebooks, AWS SageMaker, AWS Lambda, Terraform, Docker, Github Actions, ElasticSearch, and Snowflake.

Requirements
  • A cover letter is required to be considered. Please tell us about yourself and why you want to work with us!
  • Proficiency with Python and experience with Python data science libraries.
  • Experience with Deep Learning and Natural Language Processing.
  • Our start-up environment requires an imaginative thinker with the ability to work independently and the ability to collaborate effectively with other team members.
  • Exhibit both agency and initiative to find solutions to our problems.
  • Permanent legal right to work within the United States.
  • Coursework in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.
  • Recently graduated or will graduate within 1 year from an undergraduate or graduate institution.

Become the Best Version of Yourself

We want OpenSesame to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and the world we live in.
We know that a variety of perspectives and voices strengthen our ability to deliver the spark of learning to everyone.
We hold ourselves accountable to create more diverse, equitable, and inclusive communities through continuous learning, personal growth, and working to support our customers.
We welcome you to bring your authentic self to our team and grow beyond your expectations.

description:
Looking for a place to kickstart your career? Join one of the fastest growing FinTech companies in Northeast Ohio and think about applying for a rewarding Summer Internship with us! We put authentication first because we believe digital commerce should be safe, rewarding and engaging for everyone involved in the process.

Here at Cardinal, our experienced and passionate employees want to share their wisdom with you! Starting with a two-week training program, our interns participate in an Intern Immersion experience where they learn more about Cardinal’s services, hear from our Senior Leadership team and network with Cardinal employees throughout all of our different departments. With the support from their mentors, Cardinal interns are tasked with responsibilities that contribute to our bottom line and are given an environment to learn and grow. Summer interns at Cardinal walk away with real-world work experience and a network of peers and mentors to support their career development. Start your journey with Cardinal- Apply Today!

position: Full Stack Software Engineering Internship Fall 2021 at the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign Research Park
description:
YOU MUST CURRENTLY BE ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS, URBANA-CHAMPAIGN (UIUC) FOR THIS INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY WITH CARGILL AT THE UIUC RESEARCH PARK

In partnership with the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign (UIUC) Research Park, you will be given the opportunity as an intern to work with Cargill Digital Labs through our local office, The Cargill Innovation Lab at UIUC, to gain hands on experience in real business situations and be exposed to many of Cargill’s businesses and functions during the work term.

As an intern, you would work in a project team where software engineering, analytical skills, product design, UX / UI design, leadership, collaboration, inclusion, and innovation are keys to success.

As an organization, Cargill’s mission is to lead in nourishing the world in a safe, responsible and sustainable way. Cargill Digital Labs (CDL) strives to help prepare Cargill for a digital future. The vision of this future includes a thriving digital culture, continually launching of new digital business initiatives, and that Cargill will be a digital thought leader in the food and agriculture industries.

In May 2019, Cargill established a research site within UIUC’s Research Park to further this mission. In its first iteration, we leverage the site to host digital research projects, such as software, hardware and engineering prototypes that are staffed by student interns from the University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign. As we gain learnings from the experience, we will grow and mature our development capabilities within the park to best suit Cargill’s evolving digital journey.

Why intern with us?
  • Professional Experience - Gain professional experience as a software engineer working in a cross-functional team. Learn best practices from industry professionals. Understand what it is like to work within an agile software product team.
  • Build Prototypes - Work on fast-paced, digital prototype projects. Ship a functioning prototype over the course of weeks. Collaborate with clients to test prototypes and gain real-world insights.
  • Cross-Functional - Gain exposure speaking with and presenting to a variety of stakeholders across business, engineering, design and product functions. Work in tandem with a UX UI designer on understanding the user’s journey, wireframes and user interface designs.
  • Startup Culture – Wonder what it would be like to work within a product team at a software company? Or how about getting a software MVP off the ground? Your project for the semester will include building a prototype from scratch or exploring future features of an existing app. You’re paired with other software engineers and UX UI designers to go from requirements gathering, planning, design, architecture, dev, quality assurance to testing with real users over the course of a semester.
  • Use Cases That Matter – Work on real innovation initiatives that serve a variety of clients at Cargill ranging from animal nutrition, animal supply chain, food industry, learning and development, to trading and analytics. Apply your talents on digital initiatives that transform global food systems.

Having the Right Mindset

While engineering fundamentals are a must, we look for students that enjoy startup culture and are adept at working collaboratively within a team. Comfort with ambiguity is a must. Empathy for other functions and the end user is critical. Lean mindset to build the smallest thing possible is a key to success. We don’t expect you to be an expert on the entire stack, but we do look for students that are hungry to learn new things. Expand your skills in a high growth ag tech industry just a few blocks off campus.

Job Locations: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign in Champaign, IL

Required Qualifications
  • Must be currently enrolled as a student at the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign graduating between December 2021 and Summer 2023
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree with a major or minor in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other technology related discipline OR commensurate experience with software engineering in lieu of pursuing a related major/minor.
  • Must have the right to work in the US that is not based solely on the possession of a student visa or a visa sponsored by a third-party employer.
  • Able to complete at minimum a semester-long internship during the Fall 2021 semester (September – December 2021).
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds and cultures
  • Must possess a high degree of initiative and resourcefulness in completing work with limited guidance
  • Willing to take ownership of project and work
  • Must be able to complete essential functions of this job as outlined in the job description with reasonable accommodations

Preferred Qualifications
  • Pursuing a cross-disciplined degree in either Economics, Business, Food Science, or Agriculture Business.
  • Overall 3.0 GPA preferred
  • Commercial product software development experience; experience with agile development methodologies
  • Strong prioritization and problem-solving skills; collaboration skills; verbal and written communication skills; and information research and gathering skills
  • Knowledge of full-stack or mobile development, database design, and basic software engineering principles
  • Interested in returning to the Lab across additional semesters beyond Summer 2022
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and 150+ years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.

Paid Internship

Part-time

Remote, USA

Smart companies are transforming their content to be more intelligent and allow for personalization, automation, and adaptable customer experiences. [A] offers a unique opportunity for a cross-disciplinary approach to Content Intelligence. This internship will give you a chance to explore many facets of the Content Intelligence System.

Content Intelligence is the successful implementation and integration of the these principles into a cohesive system for creating, managing, and distributing content throughout its lifecycle:
  • Intelligent Customer Experience
    • Enterprise Content Strategy
    • User Experience Strategy (Customer Journey Mapping, UX Outcomes)
    • Information Architecture
  • Content Engineering
    • Content Structure (content modeling, markup, schema, DITA, XML)
    • Content "Interchange" (metadata, XML Processors and Parsers)
    • Platform implementation and maintenance (CMS, etc.)
  • Content Semantics
    • Controlled vocabularies
    • Ontology
    • Taxonomy
    • Metadata
    • Schema
  • Content Operations
    • Day-to-day management of the content processes and systems
    • Governance
    • Frameworks
    • Content supply chain
    • Facilitation
    • Training
[A] seeks motivated candidates with learning or applied experience working with content sets to be trained in Content Intelligence. Anyone with a deep interest or background in content structure, semantics, analytical philosophy, artificial intelligence, knowledge graphs, and the future of customer experience will find the internship valuable.

As a Content Intelligence Intern, you will work with our practice to craft intelligent content structure for omnichannel marketing and product documentation, and increase the value of semantically rich content. You will participate in internal and client-focused projects surrounding customer experience management and personalization. You’ll define content structure, metadata, content reuse planning, taxonomy, and other content relationships.

Interns will work with a team of [A]gents and interns across multiple disciplines within [A] to understand the depth and breadth of both client and internal Content Intelligence projects, while at the same time delivering a series of work products that contribute to their individual portfolios.

This is a remote role that can be done from anywhere in North America.

As you explore your interests, you will be exposed to the following:
  • Content modeling
  • Content Strategy
  • Analyzing content lifecycles
  • Structured authoring
  • Semantic technologies
  • Knowledge graphs
  • Structuring content through content models, taxonomies, and metadata definitions
  • Developing XML Schemas and DITA specializations
  • Planning content transformation and enrichment workflows (those parts of the content lifecycle not directly related to the subject matter authoring itself.)
  • Identifying taxonomy requirements through research and analysis of end-user needs, content management system requirements, and any existing content corpus
  • Improving client taxonomies, content models, and content workflows
  • Improving process efficiency
  • Evaluating client processes and content
  • Conducting needs analysis
  • Developing SOPs
If you have education or experience in ANY of the following …
  • Enrolled to receive a degree in Technical Communication, Library or Information Science, Computer Science, Linguistics, Analytical Philosophy, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, or similar degrees.
  • Content Design
  • Technical Communication
  • Content Management (ECMS, WCMS, CCMS)
  • Structured authoring systems (XML or other)
  • Taxonomy, thesauri, and ontology standards and best practices
  • Content workflow and lifecycles, content models, and technology environments and how these work together.
… then we would love to speak with you!

Cultural Fit at [A]
  • You love learning, you love teaching.
  • You are constantly growing your own knowledge, and helping to grow the knowledge of others.
  • You enjoy wearing multiple hats and roles, and titles are not important to you.
  • You do top-quality work, manage quality, and make everything you touch better.
  • You are comfortable working under strict confidentiality agreements and often behind-the-scenes.
  • You are self-organized and manage time and resources well.
  • You are able to not only work alone, but also communicate within a team by sending updates, tracking time, and other forms of communication while you work.
What is [A]?

[A] is the Content Intelligence Service, and we work with clients to create a Content Intelligence System. The Content Intelligence System is a holistic set of people, processes, and tools that maximize content-ROI by ensuring content is coherent, self-aware, and quantum. By creating a Content Intelligence System, we increase the effectiveness and ROI of the content assets while reducing overall costs. [A] works holistically to build all aspects of a content intelligence system in partnership with clients and agencies. This includes not just the technology architecture and implementation, but enabling companies with the organizational muscles to drive content intelligence.

What’s Up With the Name?

Our name is easy. Just say “A.” The [A] brackets represent markup, microdata, content intelligence. The letter “[A]” represents the start, initiation, beginning of change. We are going to help change the world with intelligent content.

[A] Team Benefits

Being an [A]gent comes with its benefits. Work from anywhere. Advance your career on the leading-edge of the content and technology sciences. Earn a competitive salary, and for longtime [A]gents, participation in a profit-sharing plan. But many [A]gents find the best part of working as an [A]gent are the other [A]gents you work with and the culture at [A].

We take care of each other and we honor each other's work and contributions to the team. We work to make ourselves better and our [A] team better. We make efforts to adapt new technologies and methodologies that can help us optimize our time, and we expect you to collaborate on these efforts if you’re an expert on any of those fields. We communicate and reach out to other [A] players. We love learning. We love teaching. We write. We code. We support each other. For the right people, working at [A] feels like coming home.

If this sounds like you, then write up a cover letter letting [A] know why you want to work at [A], what you do best, and what inspires you. A great cover letter will say much more than the resume (though we'd like to see that too).
